intro: Angelica komarovii, commonly known as the Siberian angelica, is a perennial herb native to the cold regions of Siberia and northern China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, hollow stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in an umbel, typical of the family. Its roots are often harvested for their aromatic and medicinal properties. Angelica komarovii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is adapted to harsh, alpine environments.
